text: Philip Levine (January 10, 1928 – February 14, 2015) was an American poet and teacher. He was best known for his poems about working-class Detroit. He taught for more than thirty years at California State University, Fresno. He also taught at other different schools. He was appointed Poet Laureate of the United States for 2011–2012. He won the Pulitzer Prize in 1995. Levine died of pancreatic cancer on February 14, 2015 in Fresno, California, aged 87. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American poets Category:California State University faculty Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:Writers from Detroit Category:Educators from Detroit
